org.jgrapes.core

Interface EventPipeline


  • public interface EventPipeline
    An event pipeline is a queue of events that are sent to the components of the associated tree. Any events fired by the components while handling an event from the pipeline are added at the end of the pipeline.

    An event pipeline is run by a single thread from a thread pool. Adding several events to the same pipeline therefore ensures that they are executed in sequence.

    Author:
    Michael N. Lipp

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(EventBase event, Channel... channels)
      Add an event to be sent to components listening for such events on the given channels to the end of the queue.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(EventBase event,
         Channel... channels)
        Add an event to be sent to components listening for such events on the given channels to the end of the queue.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to process
        channels - the channels that the event was fired on
